info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:23PM EDT until April 05 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BAMBERG AND SOUTH CENTRAL ORANGEBURG COUNTIES... At 522 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Smoaks, or 14 miles southeast of Bamberg, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Branchville around 535 PM EDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately.
